Lettering perhaps based on a font.  
Some similar ideas, mostly from connected scripts -- you would have to increase the spacing to separate the letters, or clip the tails:  
Dynastript

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022600im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DynascriptAsRed_6260.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/alphabetsoup/dynascript/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022600/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/alphabetsoup/dynascript/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/alphabetsoup/dynascript/") There are also non connecting alternate lower case letters, similar to Dynatype 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022600im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DynatypeAsRed_5039.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/alphabetsoup/dynatype/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022600/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/alphabetsoup/dynatype/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/alphabetsoup/dynatype/") but sloped.  
Draft Beer 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022600im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DraftBeerAsRed_6315.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/draft-beer/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022600/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/draft-beer/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/draft-beer/")  
Machiarge 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022600im_/http:/typophile.com/files/MachiargeAsRed_6543.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/machiarge/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022600/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/machiarge/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/machiarge/")  
Home Run Script Roman 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022600im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HomeRunScriptRomanAsRed_3816.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/doyald-young/home-run/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022600/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/doyald-young/home-run/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/doyald-young/home-run/")  
Don

> There are also non connecting alternate lower case letters

You can see them clicking on the "ff" icon

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022600im_/http:/typophile.com/files/advanced_3875.gif)
  
and selecting "Stylistic Alternates".  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022600im_/http:/typophile.com/files/7a2ac91234745a36442e4288e9df25_5838.gif)

Thanks Riccardo, those are the letters I wanted to show.  
BTW I was not able to get your technique to work on Firefox or Chrome. But it's not important.  
Don

> I was not able to get your technique to work on Firefox or Chrome

That's odd (I did it using Firefox). It's true that MyFont's javascript goes unresponsive from time to time.
Thats a huge help… thanks very much for the input!
